organic_results.title: The No Child Left Behind Act: Accountability, high-stakes testing, and roles for sociologists
organic_results.snippet: NCLB incorporated flexibility to accommodate distinctive educational issues that the states face and to promote full compliance by the states. This flexibility has created variations in testing. Eight states are using “offthe-shelf” tests, such as the Stanford 9, the Iowa Test of Basic Skills, or the California Achievement Test, which must be augmented with additional questions that focus on curricular elements. Most states have developed their own criterion-referenced tests that are aligned with the states' curricula. Valid, reliable, and fair tests …

publication_info.summary: AG Dworkin - Sociology of Education, 2005 - journals.sagepub.com
